title: Energy Minister cancels extension of power Reforms DG granted by Ministry Secretary
byline: In what appears to be an instance highlighting differences within the government, Energy Minister Kumara Jayakodi has cancelled the one-year service extension granted to Director General of the Power Sector Reforms Secretariat, Pubudu Niroshan, by Ministry Secretary Udayanga Hemapala.

title: Trump raises tariffs on Canadian goods in response to Reagan advert
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he is increasing tariffs on goods imported from Canada after the province of Ontario aired an anti-tariff advertisement featuring former President Ronald Reagan.

title: Big Ticket Sri Lankan Winner in Riyadh: Banker Wins 250gm Gold Bar After Seven Years of Trying
byline: The Big Ticket Sri Lankan Winner in Riyadh has become the talk of the town after a 63-year-old banker, Mohamed Nalim, struck gold in the popular Big Ticket Abu Dhabi weekly e-draw. The long-time expatriate, who has been living in Saudi Arabia for nearly two decades, won a 250-gram 24-karat gold bar with ticket number 173160 — a dream come true after years of persistence.

title: Cambodia and Thailand sign expanded ceasefire alongside truce-broker Trump
byline: The leaders of Thailand and Cambodia signed an enhanced ceasefire deal on Sunday in the presence of U.S. President Donald Trump, whose intervention in their fierce border conflict earned him a Nobel Peace Prize nomination.

title: Three arrested over murder of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested three individuals in connection with the murder of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera, police said.

title: Trump raises tariffs on Canadian goods in response to Reagan advert
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he is increasing tariffs on goods imported from Canada after the province of Ontario aired an anti-tariff advertisement featuring former President Ronald Reagan.

title: Two Australian women cricketers ‘touched inappropriately’ in Indore
byline: It is learnt that the concerned players were walking to a cafe at Khajrana Road, which is roughly three kilometres from their hotel when a motorcyclist committed the offence.

title: Drug eradication requires more than police: Minister
byline: Minister Vijitha Herath said that eradicating the drug menace requires more than police action alone, urging communities at the village level to actively work to stop the sale and consumption of drugs.

title: Ella Odyssey train derails at Watagoda
byline: The Ella Odyssey train, which departed Colombo Fort Railway Station at 5.30 a.m. for Badulla, derailed this afternoon (26) at Watagoda Railway Station, the Railways Department said.

title: Trump dances on red carpet as he lands in Malaysia
byline: US President Donald Trump landed in Malaysia on Sunday at Kuala Lumpur’s international airport and was greeted by Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim, as he was seen dancing briefly with a group of Malaysians performing a traditional dance.

title: India-Sri Lanka ferry service suspended
byline: The international ferry service between Nagapattinam and Kankesanthurai, Sri Lanka, has been suspended with the onset of the northeast monsoon. Operations will resume in Dec.

title: Decision-making should reflect people’s needs: Minister Abayaratne
byline: In order to make the best decisions at crucial moments when working for the people, we need a vision for the future. When we take action, we must carefully weigh the pros and cons, Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government Minister Dr. Chandana Abayaratne said.

title: Suspected gunman in Weligama Chairman murder arrested in Maharagama
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID), with support from the State Intelligence Service (SIS), have arrested a suspect believed to be the shooter in the murder of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera.

title: Two more arrested over Weligama PS Chairman’s murder
byline: Two more suspects believed to be involved in the murder of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera have been arrested, police said.

title: Deep depression over Bay of Bengal likely to intensify into severe cyclone by Oct 28
byline: The Meteorology Department has warned that a depression over the southeast Bay of Bengal has intensified into a deep depression and is likely to develop into a severe cyclonic storm by October 28.

title: Two arrested over theft of jewels at Louvre museum in Paris
byline: Two suspects have been arrested over the theft of precious crown jewels from Paris’s Louvre museum, French media say.

title: Actor Satish Shah dies at 74 In Mumbai
byline: Veteran actor Satish Shah died on Saturday. He was 74. Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit confirmed the news to NDTV.

title: Govt plans mobile phone ban for children below 12
byline: Sri Lanka plans to prohibit the use of smartphones by school children under the age of 12, Child Affairs Minister Saroja Paulraj said.

title: Saudi passenger arrested for assaulting flight attendants on SriLankan Airlines flight
byline: A 28-year-old Saudi national has been arrested after assaulting two flight attendants on a SriLankan Airlines flight from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

title: Trump dances on red carpet as he lands in Malaysia
byline: US President Donald Trump landed in Malaysia on Sunday at Kuala Lumpur’s international airport and was greeted by Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim, as he was seen dancing briefly with a group of Malaysians performing a traditional dance.

title: 'No doubt' England make World Cup final - Hartley
byline: There is ’’no doubt’’ that England will reach the Women’s World Cup final, said former spinner Alex Hartley after Nat Sciver-Brunt’s side thrashed New Zealand to conclude the group stage.

title: Chamod, Safiya Crowned South Asia’s Fastest Sprinters
byline: Sri Lankan athletes Chamod Yodhsingha and Safiya Yamic emerged as South Asia’s fastest man and woman at the 4th South Asian Senior Athletics Championship 2025, which concluded today in Ranchi, India.

title: India arrests man for stalking, touching Australian women cricketers
byline: Indian police have arrested a man accused of stalking and inappropriately touching two Australian cricketers participating in the ICC Women’s World Cup, officials said on Saturday.
